intro: Chaetostoma microlicioides, commonly known as the dwarf silver dollar fish, is a species of freshwater fish native to South America. It belongs to the family Characidae and is characterized by its small size and distinctive silver coloration. The fish has a laterally compressed body with a single dorsal fin and a rounded caudal fin. It is often found in slow-moving streams and rivers with clear water and sandy substrates. Due to its ornamental value, it is a popular species in the aquarium trade.
